Hi all!

Some of you may have seen the Lunar landing training vehicle I made a few weeks ago: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/64476-Lunar-Landing-Training-Vehicle-The-Flying-Beadstead-*DL-link

I wanted to keep the single jet but also wanted more performance. So weight reduction is the answer!

Here is the new smaller LLTV next to the previous version.

The "wasp" is faster, more maneuverable and quicker to react than the Mk 1 LLTV. She is a blast to fly!

It is still quite a challenge to land with the jet but as she weighs a lot less, the RCS can be used for fine control.

Have fun!

MJ

Sweet! You dont really need the RCS to fly the Wasp as the reaction wheel has more than enough touque. If you want the authentic LLTV feel

just switch off the torque and use the RCS to control pitch, roll, yaw. That is really tough!

You can use the RCS for fine control though. Setting the throttle low and using it to control your altitude. It makes landing a lot easier.

Its actually possible to land at full throttle. You just need to swing the craft forward and back or side to side.

Ive been fiddling with this and I have now removed all RCS and all Oxidizer to minimize weight. I have also reduced the height of the motor stack just for aesthetics.

In replace of the RCS ports I have given the 'wasp' more of a 'waspy' look.

The 'Wasp' now has a range of around 250km and a top speed of around 850 m/s at 27,000 m.

With the RCS gone its very hard to land. But entirely possible.

MJ
